channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Is Illiquidity a Blessing in Disguise for Some Investors?
item.description: Rather than running away from illiquidity, investment professionals, investors, and regulators alike should recognize its potential benefits and consider a more balanced approach.

item.title: July was the first month in over a year that didn’t set a heat record
item.description: It is the second-warmest July and second-warmest of any month recorded in the agency's records, behind only July 2023.

item.title: Scenario Planning, Foresight, and the Power of Imagination: Navigating an Uncertain Future
item.description: By fostering resilience through the consideration of various outcomes, investment practitioners can better anticipate and manage the complexities and disruptions that characterize today's dynamic environment.

item.title: Italy doubles its ‘billionaires tax’ to €200,000 for super-rich expats
item.description: 1,186 high-net-worth individuals have transferred their tax residency to Italy since the policy was first introduced in 2017.

item.title: Private Equity: In Essence, Plunder?
item.description: To understand what private equity is at its worst is a call to action, personally and professionally.

item.title: Hyundai debuts a new EV facility in Thailand, as the ‘Detroit of Asia’ pivots to making electric cars
item.description: The Korean carmaker is pushing into Thailand right as Chinese EVs are starting to pull ahead of Japanese brands.

item.title: Small Caps, Large Caps, and Interest Rates
item.description: The relationship between stocks and interest rates is not reliably stable. There are periods when equities are highly rate sensitive, and periods when they aren't.

item.title: Jamie Dimon is done psychoanalyzing the Fed
item.description: "Every day 325 million Americans go to work, go to their jobs, take care of their families, take care of their kids, build out their house, change a job. And it could be affected by the Fed changing rates by 50 base points? I don't think so."

item.title: How Well Does the Market Predict Volatility?
item.description: How accurate is VIX on a realized basis and when does it diverge with the market?

item.title: 75% of carry trade blamed in recent stock meltdown has been unwound, JPMorgan says
item.description: The carry strategy — which involves borrowing at low rates to fund purchases in higher-yielding assets elsewhere — has been wobbling for months.
